text: I'm going to show you today how to use a
lay space lay space is basically a 4d
gel so if you look when I open it up
it's it's like the consistency of wax I
mean it doesn't go anywhere and so these
are used to create beautiful 3d lace
designs or any type of fantasy or 3d
nail art that you can imagine today I'm
just going to show you a pretty easy way
to use it on like an everyday client in
the nail salon so as you can see I have
it I'm wearing some gloves and I'm just
going to roll this into sort of a little
snake nice and thin and I'm actually
going to get rid of half of this this is
going to ensure that this goes on nice
and thin on the nail here's my little
snake just gently press that where I
want it to stick so I'm going for kind
of a v-shape here so there's my little
v-shape so what you have to do is you
have to start to spread this product
nice and thin using the spoon pusher and
I'm just going to gently start to press
you can even use your finger a little
bit if you'd like so whatever works best
for you but this stuff needs to be as
thin as could be on that nails almost to
where it's like see-through even one of
my favorite tools the squish those stuff
down is the clear Stamper because the
stuff won't stick to it and it really
starts to smooth the product out I'm
going to take my little silicone tool
I'm going to use those to just get our
edges fixed up here this is where all
the work goes into this product after
this it's just plain fun have a nice
edge again and now I can either grab my
clear stamper and start to press this
out with the clear stamper or I can use
my finger or whatever tool I feel like
works best to do this now I'm going to
take my dotting tool we just have these
ones made so they have a little teeny
weeny mini side and then another small
side and if you look at most lace that
has a pattern to it you can see a lot of
flowers in them so I start with my
largest holes I'm going to use my
dotting tool to just open this up I'm
going to make some large holes here in
the lay space and then if I want to
flatten see
some of these have little lips now so I
want to flatten that I just come in ever
so gently with my clear Stamper and just
flatten that back down again
sometimes you'll start to poke little
shapes in here it'll mess up your
original shape you can just come back in
and fix that right up
the best advice I could give you is to
have a pattern in mind and be creative
because if you don't have a plan it just
looks like Swiss cheese it's actually
like what would be considered of 4d gel
that I'm using and so this absolutely
has to cure in the lamp just like any
other gel would this cures for 30
seconds in an LED light for 2 minutes in
a UV light I really love all the cool
looks you can create with this you just
need to do it in a flattering way so
that it looks like lace if you want to
change the color you can take just a
little tiny bit of pigment if you have
like a pure pigment powder and you can
mix the pigment into the lace paste and
kind of mush it around in your fingers a
little bit but just a little tiny tiny
bit so learn what are your time-saving
tips when it comes to doing nail art I
think a lot of people see stuff like
this maybe that's so elaborate but I
mean like you might take a lot of time
for nails my biggest tip is to try the
technique first that way you know how
much time it does take you once you have
your time figured out I mean you can
easily calculate then how much you need
to charge especially if it's like some
type of you know high-end product that
it was very expensive for you like the
chrome things like that in order to
really make a price list you don't just
say hey what are you charging what are
you encouraging because we all do that
that's not how you do it you figure out
what it cost you how long it takes you
to do it and then you figure out what
your nail art is worth you know so for
me personally when I was doing nails
full-time I loved Tammy Taylor used to
teach about bringing in $40 an hour so
for someone like myself if I'm going to
spend 15 minutes doing nail art that's
ten dollars that I need to be charging
for that 15 minutes if that male art
includes expensive Swarovski crystals or
chrome powder or something that's really
costly and expensive above and beyond
then I will charge above and beyond
for that so this goes over like a
completely finished nail so this
particular nail like I put black gel
polish on it cured it then I put the top
coat on it and cured it and then I wipe
the sticky layer off so it's like
totally finished nail and this adheres
perfectly so after I've have my design
on there if you can see there's just a
little residue right here I can wipe
that off with just a little bit of

to go ahead and stick this in the lamp
